name: Amir Houman Sadr
content: Amir Houmansadr | UMass Amherst Skip to content Amir Houmansadr Professor Manning College of Information and Computer Sciences University of Massachusetts Amherst Email: amir (at) cs.umass.edu [ Public Key ]; Office: 206 Online: Twitter · LinkedIn Bio: I am a Full Professor of Computer Science at the University of Massachusetts Amherst, where I have been a faculty member since Fall 2014 (tenured in Fall 2019). I received my Ph.D. from the University of Illinois at Urbana‑Champaign in 2012 and subsequently spent two years as a postdoctoral scholar at the University of Texas at Austin. Prior to that, I earned my M.Sc. and B.Sc. degrees from Sharif University of Technology. Research Area: My research focuses on network and AI security and privacy , with particular emphasis on privacy‑enhancing technologies and trustworthy AI . I design and deploy censorship circumvention systems, analyze network protocols and services (e.g., messaging platforms and machine‑learning APIs) for privacy leakage, use theoretical tools such as game theory and information theory to derive privacy bounds, and evaluate the security and privacy of emerging AI technologies. Research Team: I lead the Secure, Private Internet (SPIN) Research Group and co‑lead the UMass AI Security Lab . Selected Awards USENIX Security Honorable Mention, 2025 The Caspar Bowden PET Award Runner Up, 2025 FOCI Best Practical Paper Award, 2025 DARPA Director's Award, 2024 COLM Spotlight Paper, 2024 Applied Networking Research Prize (ANRP), 2024 ACM CCS Distinguished Paper Award, 2023 First place at CSAW Applied Research Competition, 2023 Best Practical Paper Award of the FOCI Community, 2023 DARPA Young Faculty Award (YFA), 2022 ACM IMC Best Paper Award Runner‑Up, 2020 CSAW Applied Research Competition Finalist, 2019 NSF CAREER Award, 2016 Google Faculty Research Award, 2015 IEEE S&P Best Practical Paper Award, 2013 News 2025-11-03: Gave a Keynote at Brazil's National backbone Internet measurement (RNP) ! 2025-09-01: Promoted to Full Professor! 2025-08-12: Our paper received an Honorable Mention Award from USENIX Security'25 (top 6% of accepted papers)! 2025-07-17: Our paper on the blocking of fully encrypted protocols recognized as The 2025 Caspar Bowden PET Award Runner Up! 2025-07-14: Spoke on a panel on Internet freedom at PETS ! 2025-07-14: Wallbleed receives the Best Practical Paper Award of 2025 from the FOCI Community! 2025-05-24: The Guardian writes about our Oakland'25 paper ! 2025-05-22: Served on the Privacy Panel at Brazil's SBRC ! 2025-02-28: I gave a keynote at IMPACT ! 2025-01-27: Interview with MassLive on Internet freedom! 2025-01-22: I was on The Fabulous 413 ! 2025-01-06: Article covering our DARPA Director's Award ! 2024-12-01: CensorLab , our censorship emulation testbed, is online! 2024-10-05: Interviewed by WBZ NewsRadio 1030 on online safety. 2024-10-01: Our COLM paper on LLM prompt reproduction is selected as a Spotlight! 2024-02-21: Interviewed by MassLive on Russian Wi‑Fi malware . 2024-01-12: Our USENIX Security paper won a 2024 Applied Networking Research Prize (ANRP) . 2023-11-29: Our CCS'23 paper received a Distinguished Paper Award! 2023-11-11: Our USENIX Security paper won first place at CSAW 2023 Applied Research Competition . 2023-07-10: Our upcoming USENIX Security paper received the 2023 Best Practical Paper Award from the FOCI Community. 2023-05-05: Gave the keynote talk at ICLR BANDS 2023 Workshop . 2023-04-01: Served on a panel at Shasha Seminar for Human Concerns . 2022-10-05: TechCrunch covers GFW Report's findings about TLS censorship. 2022-08-11: Received a DARPA Young Faculty Award (YFA). 2021-07-29: Two finalist proposals for Facebook Privacy‑Enhancing Technologies . 2020-12-10: Invited blog post on the use of ML for censorship circumvention. 2020-10-27: Best Paper Award Runner‑up at ACM IMC'20. 2020-09-01: Interview with The Wire China on recent developments in censorship techniques. 2020-08-08: ZDNet article on our collaborative study of ESNI censorship. 2020-01-23: Three papers accepted at NDSS'20! 2019-11-01: DeepCorr is a finalist at the CSAW’19 Applied Research Competition! 2019-09-01: Promoted to associate professor with tenure! 2018-07-24: Two papers accepted at ACM CCS'18! 2018-05-30: TV interview on Net Neutrality . [+] Older News… 2017-08-22: Received a collaborative NSF Award to investigate IoT Privacy! 2017-08-02: 2/2 papers accepted at ACM CCS'17! Congrats to my students Hadi and Milad! 2017-05-15: Received a collaborative NSF/Intel Award to investigate future network architectures! 2017-04-07: Spoke at a panel at the Obfuscation Workshop at NYU. 2016-12-09: Moderated a panel on Internet censorship at ACSAC 2016 . 2016-11-09: Keynote on Internet censorship at SBSeg 2016 in Niteroi, Brazil. 2016-07-25: Received a collaborative Medium NSF Award to investigate Covert Communications! 2016-07-23: 2/2 papers accepted at CCS'16! Congrats to my students, Hadi and Milad! 2016-02-25: Book on Information Hiding is published! 2016-01-27: Received an NSF CAREER Award ! 2015-12-16: Co‑chaired the 2016 USENIX Workshop on FOCI! 2015-11-20: MIT Technology Review article on CacheBrowser. 2015-07-24: Received an NSF Award to investigate statistical traffic analysis. 2015-02-12: Awarded a Google Faculty Research Award . 2014-05-16: Joining Computer Science at UMass Amherst as an Assistant Professor in the Fall. 2013-11-25: Paper accepted at NDSS 2014: "No Direction Home: The True Cost of Routing Around Decoys." 2013-05-21: Paper won the Best Practical Paper award at IEEE S&P 2013. 2013-01-28: Paper accepted at IEEE S&P 2013: "The Parrot is Dead: Observing Unobservable Network Communications." 2012-10-20: Paper accepted at NDSS 2013: "I want my voice to be heard: IP over VoIP for unobservable censorship circumvention." 2012-07-09: Joined the University of Texas at Austin as a postdoc. 2011-09-01: Featured on UIUC ECE and CSL websites. 2011-07-21: Interviewed by New Scientist about Stegobot . 2011-07-15: Paper Cirripede accepted to ACM CCS 2011.
